revision.comment: Signing comment by [[User:Julianq|Julianq]] - "Added a comment suggesting an area for further fleshing out."
revision.text: {{WikiProject Classical Greece and Rome|class=start|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Death|class=start|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Religion|class=Start|importance=Top}} == == This is a fake page, I saw the freshman in my school make it up. :Comment on the above. This is not a "fake page". However, the article needs fleshing out a bit. The ''di parentes'' (thus, parentalia) are important in Roman religion, and provided a pattern for the Imperial cult. In other words, very important. [[User:Haploidavey|Haploidavey]] ([[User talk:Haploidavey|talk]]) 15:03, 23 May 2009 (UTC) I would be interested in knowing the connection to Dia de los Muertos celebrated by the Mexicans. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Julianq|Julianq]] ([[User talk:Julianq|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Julianq|contribs]]) 21:53, 31 October 2012 (UTC) ==copy-edit== The ''di parentes'' and the ''parentalia'' deserve a much more thorough treatment. The status of the ''di parentes'' provided a Roman precedent for the ''divus'' (and even the ''deus'') of Imperial cult. I have relevant modern sources, and will be copy-editing this article in tandem with [[Imperial cult (ancient Rome)]]. As and when useful additions crop up in the course of the latter, I'll pop them into this article. Meantime, I'll change the title - if I can. [[User:Haploidavey|Haploidavey]] ([[User talk:Haploidavey|talk]]) 13:08, 24 May 2009 (UTC) ==Problems== Beard et al (see refs in article) say a Vestal was involved in the first rites of Parentalia, making its first day at least a semi-public cultus, and that the festival was "private" and domestic throughout thereafter. Paul the Deacon/Festus apparently calls the Feralia (last day of Parentalia?) a public rite, and so does the Brittanica (Online). Perhaps Feralia is actually not part of Parentalia... any help out there? [[User:Haploidavey|Haploidavey]] ([[User talk:Haploidavey|talk]]) 21:29, 26 May 2009 (UTC) Online help there was - if any problems remain, I'll implore once more. [[User:Haploidavey|Haploidavey]] ([[User talk:Haploidavey|talk]]) 23:10, 26 May 2009 (UTC) I removed some uncited material that seemed fanciful - families perambulating the cemetery on a nice day out etc. [[User:Haploidavey|Haploidavey]] ([[User talk:Haploidavey|talk]]) 21:56, 26 May 2009 (UTC) :Actually, families did perambulate and picnic at the cemeteries — they shared bread and wine among themselves, and as offerings to the ancestors. As you noted above (two years ago, I see!), this could be developed better. The impression I have, however, is that this will not be as easy as it might seem, since there are some disagreements about the form of ceremonies. [[User:Cynwolfe|Cynwolfe]] ([[User talk:Cynwolfe|talk]]) 13:51, 1 April 2011 (UTC)
